headline: AI Earnings Dominate: NVDA Consensus Split, SPY Divided Across Models
summary: Today's predictions reveal a market divided on tech's direction following strong AI earnings, particularly Nvidia's beat on Q4 revenue ($68.13B). Three models (GPT-4o, Grok, Perplexity) bullishly aligned on SPY while Claude and Perplexity diverged. NVDA saw the most disagreement with Claude and Perplexity predicting upside versus GPT-4o's bearish call, while CRM faced near-consensus bearishness on disappointing FY2027 guidance.

consensus_picks.note: Three of five models predicted up (including Perplexity), while Claude and Perplexity diverged on the broad market direction.
Strong Q4 earnings ($68.13B, +73% YoY) drove bullish consensus, but GPT-4o's downgrade call and Grok's extreme $950 target create significant disagreement on magnitude.
Claude's 85% confidence down call on FY2027 guidance miss represents the day's highest-conviction single prediction, with premarket already down 5%.
GPT-4o bullish on earnings strength versus Grok's bearish stance on European production delaysâ€”a notable conflict on the same catalyst.

best_call.summary: Claude's 85% confidence down prediction on Salesforce benefited from concrete premarket evidence (5% decline) tied to disappointing FY2027 revenue guidance ($45.8-46.2B vs expectations).

worst_call.summary: Grok's $950 target for NVDA appears wildly optimistic relative to other models' $140-145.50 range and disconnected from actual premarket momentum despite bullish sentiment; extreme overconfidence on social media chatter.
